Authors:
Viviana Andrea Barrera, Leopoldo Javier Iannone, Andrea
Irene Romero, Priscila Chaverri
Title:
Expanding the Trichoderma harzianum species complex: Three
new species from Argentinian natural and cultivated ecosystems
Keywords:
actin; calmodulin; phylogeny; systematics; taxonomy;
translation elongation factor 1-Î±; 3 new taxa
Abstract:
A study was performed on a collection of 84 isolates from
decaying plant tissues and soils in Argentina previously identified as
Trichoderma harzianum. Based on multiple phenotypic characters and
multilocus phylogenetic analyses, ten species were distinguished, three
of which are described as new species: T. austroindianum, T. hortense,
and T. syagri. Among the remaining seven identified species, the
following five can be added to the Argentine mycobiota: T. afarasin, T.
afroharzianum, T. endophyticum, T. guizhouense, and T. neotropicale.
Trichoderma afroharzianum and T. endophyticum were the most frequent
species found in the samples. In addition, a collection of isolates
previously identified as T. harzianum with antagonistic abilities were
re-identified as T. afroharzianum, thus, highlighting the importance of
correct identification of biocontrol species.
